history.summary: Extreme Engineering Solutions is a single board computer design and manufacture company. Their products are used in industries like aviation, military, computing, and many more. I worked on the U-Boot bootloader team during my time here.
highlights: Worked full time on embedded systems alongside professional embedded engineers
Created continuous integration builds using Jenkins, Robot, and Python
Set up system for automated testing on the projects I worked on
Researched and implemented Freescale Secure Boot technologies in U-Boot for PowerPC
Helped troubleshoot and review code to be added to repository
Assisted in onboarding new students to U-Boot team

history.summary: Maverick Software Consulting bridges the need for students to get on the job experience, and other companies desire for college student talent. While at maverick I worked as a student consultant for Thomson Reuters working on a law web application.
highlights: Software Development working 20 hours a week alongside full class schedule
Contractor for Thomson Reuters, working on current production products alongside lead developers
Updated legacy code to new MVC5 formats, making product more modern
Participated in agile standup meetings discussing future plans for projects and what developers were working on
Communicated with team daily on current progress and any pain points, participating in meetings as needed
Researched and applied new technologies that had potential use and application in our product

recognition.title: IEEE-HKN Honor Society
recognition.summary: Top quarter of juniors, top third of seniors, 2015-Present
